title: Authors and Citation
text: Matthew Pancia. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Pancia M (2025). firstcoursecausaldata: Data Sets "First Course Causal Inference". R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/mpancia/firstcoursecausaldata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {firstcoursecausaldata: Data Sets for "A First Course in Causal Inference"},   author = {Matthew Pancia},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/mpancia/firstcoursecausaldata}, }

title: Data Sets for
text: R data package accompanying Peng Ding’s (2024) book First Course Causal Inference. package contains datasets used illustrate key concepts methods causal inference research.

title: Data Sets for
text: can install development version firstcoursecausaldata GitHub:
code: # Install devtools if you don't have it already # install.packages("devtools")  # Install the package from GitHub devtools::install_github("mpancia/firstcoursecausaldata")

title: Data Sets for
text: lalonde: National Supported Work program data Lalonde (1986) evaluating treatment effects resumecallback: Resume audit study data Bertrand Mullainathan (2004) racial discrimination hiring finasteride: Multicenter trial data Gould (1998) studying finasteride treatment benign prostatic hyperplasia imbens2015star: Student/Teacher Achievement Ratio (STAR) experiment data Imbens Rubin (2015) evaluating class size effects student achievement koenker2002: Job training program data Koenker Xiao (2002) studying duration employment stratified randomization quarter electriccompany: Electric Company educational experiment data evaluating effectiveness educational television reading scores angrist2009: Academic performance incentives experiment data Angrist et al. (2009) evaluating strategies improve college freshmen academic performance support services financial incentives

title: Data Sets for
text: package licensed CC0. See LICENSE.md details.

what: Academic Performance Incentives Experiment Dataset — angrist2009
title: Academic Performance Incentives Experiment Dataset — angrist2009
text: dataset Angrist et al. (2009) containing data randomized experiment conducted Canadian university evaluate different strategies improve academic performance among college freshmen. data focuses control group treatment group offered academic support services financial incentives good grades.

title: Academic Performance Incentives Experiment Dataset — angrist2009
Academic Performance Incentives Experiment Dataset — angrist2009
text: data frame 1,656 observations 48 variables: GPA_year1, GPA_year2 Double. 1st 2nd year GPA age Double. Age gpa0 Double. High school GPA control Logical. Control group indicator (TRUE = control, FALSE = treatment) female Logical. Female dummy english Logical. Mother tongue English credits_earned1, credits_earned2 Double. Credits earned years 1 2 totcredits_year1 Double. Total credits attempted finish4 Logical. Intends finish 4 years goodstanding_year1, goodstanding_year2 Logical. Good standing years 1 2 prob_year1, prob_year2 Logical. probation years 1 2 mom_edn, dad_edn Double. Mother father education mom1, mom2, dad1, dad2 Logical. Mother/father HS college graduate indicators mtongue, sex Character. Mother tongue sex hsgroup Double. High school group chooseUTM Logical. 1st choice school hcom Logical. Lives home mathsci Double. Number math science credits attempted work1 Logical. Plans work school numcourses_nov1 Double. Courses enrolled fall 2005 grade_20059_fall Double. Fall grade lastmin Double. often leaves studying last minute lm_never, lm_rarely Logical. Never/rarely puts studying tests sfp, sfp_p, sfsp, sfsp_p Logical. Offered/signed-student support programs sfpany, sfpany_p Logical. Offered/signed-support program ssp, ssp_p Logical. Offered/signed-student services program used_ssp, used_fsg, used_adv Logical. Received SSP services, attended FSGs, met advisor compsurv, noshow, signup Logical. Completed survey, show, signed STAR graddeg Logical. Wants BA

title: Academic Performance Incentives Experiment Dataset — angrist2009
text: Angrist, J., Lavy, V., Schlosser, . (2009). effects high stakes high school achievement awards: Evidence randomized trial. American Economic Review, 99(4), 1384-1414. Data obtained Harvard Dataverse: https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/ZX3VEV

title: Academic Performance Incentives Experiment Dataset — angrist2009
text: experiment randomly assigned college freshmen different treatment conditions including academic support services (SFP, SSP, SFSP) financial incentives good grades. primary outcomes academic performance measures GPA first second years, completion rates, academic standing.

title: Academic Performance Incentives Experiment Dataset — angrist2009
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(angrist2009) summary(angrist2009) table(angrist2009$control) mean(angrist2009$GPA_year1[!angrist2009$control])  # Treatment group GPA mean(angrist2009$GPA_year1[angrist2009$control])   # Control group GPA } # }

title: Electric Company Experiment Dataset — electriccompany
text: dataset Children's Television Workshop experiment evaluating Electric Company educational television show.

title: Electric Company Experiment Dataset — electriccompany
text: data frame 96 observations 7 variables: city Factor. City identifier grade Integer. Grade level (1-4) treated_pre_test Double. Pre-test reading scores treated classrooms treated_post_test Double. Post-test reading scores treated classrooms control_pre_test Double. Pre-test reading scores control classrooms control_post_test Double. Post-test reading scores control classrooms supplement Factor. Supplemental material indicator ("S" "R")

title: Electric Company Experiment Dataset — electriccompany
text: Data obtained Andrew Gelman's website: https://stat.columbia.edu/~gelman/arm/examples/ARM_Data.zip

title: Electric Company Experiment Dataset — electriccompany
text: experiment contains eight pairs classes one class randomly assigned watch Electric Company reading period, received standard instruction. Pre-test scores serve covariates post-test scores outcomes interest.

title: Finasteride Multicenter Trial Dataset — finasteride
text: dataset Gould (1998) containing summary statistics stratified randomized trial studying efficacy tolerability finasteride treating benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Within 29 centers, patients randomized three arms: control, finasteride 1mg, finasteride 5mg. centers serve strata stratified randomized experiment (SRE).

title: Finasteride Multicenter Trial Dataset — finasteride
text: data frame 29 observations (centers) 10 variables: center Integer. Center ID (1-29) n0 Integer. Sample size control group mean0 Double. Mean change symptom score control group sd0 Double. Standard deviation change control group n1 Integer. Sample size finasteride 1mg group mean1 Double. Mean change symptom score finasteride 1mg group sd1 Double. Standard deviation change finasteride 1mg group n5 Integer. Sample size finasteride 5mg group mean5 Double. Mean change symptom score finasteride 5mg group sd5 Double. Standard deviation change finasteride 5mg group

title: Finasteride Multicenter Trial Dataset — finasteride
text: Gould, . Lawrence. "Multi‐centre trial analysis revisited." Statistics Medicine 17.15‐16 (1998): 1779-1797. Data obtained Harvard Dataverse: https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/ZX3VEV

title: Finasteride Multicenter Trial Dataset — finasteride
text: outcome change baseline total symptom score BPH. total symptom score ranges 0 36 (sum 9 questions, scored 0-4) symptoms impaired urinary ability. Negative values indicate improvement symptoms.

title: STAR Experiment Dataset — imbens2015star
text: dataset Imbens Rubin (2015) containing data Student/Teacher Achievement Ratio (STAR) experiment conducted 1985-1986 Tennessee. large-scale randomized experiment evaluate effect class size student achievement. data long format schools serving strata.

title: STAR Experiment Dataset — imbens2015star
text: data frame 68 observations (classrooms) 4 variables: school Integer. School ID (1-16), serving strata stratified randomized experiment classroom Integer. Classroom identifier within school treatment Integer. Treatment indicator (1 = small class (13-17 students), 0 = regular class (22-25 students)) outcome Double. Standardized average mathematics score

title: STAR Experiment Dataset — imbens2015star
text: Imbens, Guido W., Donald B. Rubin. Causal inference statistics, social, biomedical sciences. Cambridge University Press, 2015.

title: STAR Experiment Dataset — imbens2015star
text: STAR experiment 4-year study comparing student performance small classes (13-17 students) versus regular classes (22-25 students). Students randomly assigned within schools, making stratified randomized experiment schools serve strata. outcome represents standardized mathematics scores, allowing comparison across different assessment scales. dataset represents subset original STAR data, focusing first year experiment mathematics scores primary outcome interest.

title: STAR Experiment Dataset — imbens2015star
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(imbens2015star) summary(imbens2015star) table(imbens2015star$school) mean(imbens2015star$outcome[imbens2015star$treatment == 1])  # Small classes mean(imbens2015star$outcome[imbens2015star$treatment == 0])  # Regular classes } # }

title: Job Training Program Dataset — koenker2002
text: dataset Koenker Xiao (2002) containing data job training program stratified quarter. dataset contains information duration employment participants randomized controlled trial evaluating effectiveness job training programs. stratified randomized experiment quarters serve strata.

title: Job Training Program Dataset — koenker2002
text: data frame 6,384 observations 13 variables: id Integer. Participant ID duration Double. Duration employment (time employment outcome) treatment Logical. Treatment indicator (FALSE = control, TRUE = job training program) female Logical. Gender indicator (FALSE = male, TRUE = female) black Logical. Race indicator (FALSE = Black, TRUE = Black) hispanic Logical. Ethnicity indicator (FALSE = Hispanic, TRUE = Hispanic) ndependents Integer. Number dependents recall Logical. Recall indicator (FALSE = recall, TRUE = recall) young Logical. Age indicator (FALSE = young, TRUE = young) old Logical. Age indicator (FALSE = old, TRUE = old) quarter Factor. Quarter randomization (0-5), serving strata stratified randomized experiment durable Logical. Durable goods indicator (FALSE = , TRUE = yes) lusd Logical. Long-term unemployment indicator (FALSE = , TRUE = yes)

title: Job Training Program Dataset — koenker2002
text: Koenker, Roger, Zhijie Xiao. "Inference quantile regression process." Econometrica 70.4 (2002): 1583-1612. Data obtained Harvard Dataverse: https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/ZX3VEV

title: Job Training Program Dataset — koenker2002
text: dataset represents job training program evaluation participants randomized receive job training serve controls. Randomization stratified quarter ensure balance across time periods. primary outcome duration employment, representing time took participants find employment intervention.

title: Job Training Program Dataset — koenker2002
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(koenker2002) summary(koenker2002) table(koenker2002$treatment) mean(koenker2002$duration[koenker2002$treatment == TRUE])  # Treatment group mean(koenker2002$duration[koenker2002$treatment == FALSE])  # Control group table(koenker2002$quarter)  # Distribution across strata } # }

what: Lalonde (1986) National Supported Work Dataset — lalonde
title: Lalonde (1986) National Supported Work Dataset — lalonde
text: dataset Robert Lalonde's 1986 study "Evaluating Econometric Evaluations Training Programs Experimental Data". dataset contains information National Supported Work (NSW) program, temporary employment program designed help disadvantaged workers improve labor market prospects.

title: Lalonde (1986) National Supported Work Dataset — lalonde
Lalonde (1986) National Supported Work Dataset — lalonde
text: data frame 16,177 observations 10 variables: treat Logical. Treatment indicator (TRUE = received NSW training, FALSE = control group) age Integer. Age years educ Integer. Years education completed black Logical. TRUE respondent Black hispan Logical. TRUE respondent Hispanic married Logical. TRUE respondent married nodegree Logical. TRUE respondent high school diploma re74 Double. Real earnings 1974 (pre-treatment) re75 Double. Real earnings 1975 (pre-treatment) re78 Double. Real earnings 1978 (post-treatment outcome)

title: Lalonde (1986) National Supported Work Dataset — lalonde
text: LaLonde, Robert J. "Evaluating econometric evaluations training programs experimental data." American economic review (1986): 604-620. Data obtained Harvard Dataverse: https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/ZX3VEV

title: Lalonde (1986) National Supported Work Dataset — lalonde
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(lalonde) summary(lalonde) table(lalonde$treat) mean(lalonde$re78[lalonde$treat == TRUE]) # Average earnings for treated mean(lalonde$re78[lalonde$treat == FALSE]) # Average earnings for control } # }

title: Resume Audit Study Dataset — resumecallback
text: dataset Bertrand Mullainathan (2004) studying racial discrimination labor market. researchers conducted randomized experiment sending fictitious resumes either Black-sounding White-sounding names help-wanted ads Boston Chicago newspapers measure effect perceived race callback rates interviews.

title: Resume Audit Study Dataset — resumecallback
text: data frame 4,870 observations 4 variables: firstname Character. First name used resume sex Factor. Sex applicant ("male" "female") race Factor. Perceived race based name ("black" "white") call Logical. Callback indicator (TRUE = received callback, FALSE = callback)

title: Resume Audit Study Dataset — resumecallback
text: Bertrand, M., & Mullainathan, S. (2004). Emily Greg Employable Lakisha Jamal? Field Experiment Labor Market Discrimination. American Economic Review, 94(4), 991-1013. Data obtained Harvard Dataverse: https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/ZX3VEV

title: Resume Audit Study Dataset — resumecallback
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(resumecallback) summary(resumecallback) table(resumecallback$race) mean(resumecallback$call[resumecallback$race == "white"])  # Callback rate for white-sounding names mean(resumecallback$call[resumecallback$race == "black"])  # Callback rate for black-sounding names } # }
